discussion.content:
Not D. Fortiweb is listen for either ICMP type 0 (ECHO_RESPONSE), NOT request.
https://docs.fortinet.com/document/fortiweb/6.3.7/cli-reference/672415/server-policy-health#config_1208537978_4022289

B is correct
D is incorrect as the fortiweb must receive an ICMP "echo_response" from the server.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

Selected Answer: D
B and D. ICMP echo also expected.

choices.A: The FortiWeb must receive an RST packet from the server.
choices.D: The FortiWeb must receive an ICMP Echo Request from the server.
choices.B: The FortiWeb must receive an HTTP 200 response code from the server.
choices.C: The FortiWeb must match the hash value of the page index.html.

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

You created a custom health-check for your FortiWeb deployment.
Given the output shown in the exhibit, which statement is true?

discussion.content:
Min links is just to enable link aggregation, so answer is A
https://community.fortinet.com/t5/FortiGate/Technical-Note-Explanation-of-min-links-and-link-failure/ta-p/191589

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

A FortiGate device is configured to authenticate SSL VPN users using digital certificates. A partial FortiGate configuration is shown in the exhibit.
Referring to the exhibit, which two statements about this configuration are true? (Choose two.)

choices.C: The authentication will fail if the OCSP server is down.
choices.A: The authentication will fail if the user certificate does not contain the user principal name (UPN) information.
choices.D: OCSP is used to verify that the user-signed certificate has not expired.
choices.B: The authentication will fail if the user certificate does not contain the CA_Cert string in the CA field.

discussion.content: D is wrong because OCSP validate if certificate was revoked or not https://community.fortinet.com/t5/FortiGate/Technical-Tip-How-to-enable-OCSP/ta-p/198293

Selected Answer: AC
AC is correct as per the link https://docs.fortinet.com/document/fortigate/6.2.0/cookbook/751987/ssl-vpn-with-ldap-integrated-certificate-authentication
